content: Building in Ann Siang Road, Singapore 1°16′52.6″N 103°50′43.5″E﻿ / ﻿1.281278°N 103.845417°E﻿ / 1.281278; 103.845417 **Damenlou Hotel** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese): 大门楼旅店) was a small [hotel](/wiki/Hotel) located at [Ann Siang Road](/wiki/Ann_Siang_Road), in [Chinatown](/wiki/Chinatown,_Singapore), within the [Central Area](/wiki/Central_Area,_Singapore) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). Damenlou Hotel's origins can be traced to the creation of the dish of fish head [mifen](/wiki/Mifen) (rice [vermicelli](/wiki/Vermicelli)), which was invented by Tang Kwong Swee in the 1920s. The hotel had a famous restaurant, named *Swee Kee*. By mid-2007, Damenlou Hotel had ceased operations. Its premises have been taken over by the *Screening Room*, a dining and entertainment venue with bistro, movie theatre and rooftop bar. Accompanying this change, the hotel facade and interior have been heavily renovated. - Screening Room website This article about a [hotel](/wiki/Hotel) or [resort](/wiki/Resort) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Damenlou Hotel
